lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Nov. 27 front-page article on the debate in California over math instruction leaves the impression that the new approach advocated by the National Council of Teachers of Mathematics excludes the learning of computation by hand and considers the expression of ''feelings'' about mathematics to be evidence of mathematical success.
abstract: Prof Mel Bienenfeld letter disputes November 27 article on debate in California over math instruction; drawing (S)

headline.main: New Math Instruction Doesn't Ignore Basic Skills
